div.p: Join the Apple Maps team in the R&D branch to shape the future of Apple Maps. We create and seamlessly integrate technologies that enrich peopleâ€™s lives with a focus on user-experience. If you're passionate about building technologies that are going to make a difference in the future, we would like to talk to you!

ul.li: Background in mathematics and/or statistics is highly desirable
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Hands-on programming skills in a major language, such as C++ or Java
Hands-on knowledge of prototyping languages, such as MATLAB or Python with NumPy/SciPy libraries
Ability to take ideas from concept to prototype and to the software product
Ability to work in cross-functional teams with a strong sense of self-direction

div.p: You will be a key member of a team that is pursuing future products of Apple maps. In that role, you will be expected to think out-of-the box, investigate a set of research hypotheses and shape them into a meaningful definition that can be demonstrated with a prototype and subsequently implemented in a production-grade code. The problem space may include various numerical methods, machine learning, 3D geometry and/or routing algorithms.
- M.S. or PhD in Computer Science or related field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or Electrical Engineering.

Preferred, but not necessary: - Familiarity with Geo Spatial data or computational geometry - Numerical methods, machine learning, routing algorithms, big data, computer vision or computational geometry
